What are Hash Functions?

Hash functions are mathematical algorithms that convert data of arbitrary size to fixed-size values. They are essential for data integrity, password storage, and digital signatures.

Common Hash Algorithms:

  • MD5 - Fast but vulnerable to collisions
  • SHA-1 - Older algorithm with known weaknesses
  • SHA-256 - Part of SHA-2 family, widely used today
  • SHA-512 - Provides higher security with 512-bit digests
); }; export default Home;
